thread.title: Scramble benefits Breakfast Lions, Boys & Girls Club
thread.title_full: Scramble benefits Breakfast Lions, Boys & Girls Club

author: hdmoadmin
title: Scramble benefits Breakfast Lions, Boys & Girls Club
text:
6:02 am - October 20, 2015 Scramble benefits Breakfast Lions, Boys & Girls Club Brad Baker, part of the winning Flight A team, demonstrates great style, both in his swing and his golf attire. Hank Innfeldt hits up to the green on No. 11. Innfeldt was one of the Flight A winners. Jim Rowley appeared to be having a great time – the course was in excellent shape and the weather was perfect for a round of golf. Nestor Dokousian putts for his team. 
By MARY ELIADES 
Staff writer 
Eighty-four golfers hit the links Oct. 3 to raise funds for Breakfast Lions projects and the Paul Bewie Boys & Girls Club. 
Balboa Golf Course was the setting for the annual joint event, which was sponsored by Village Yogurt, All American Classics, Eyecare Specialties, City Plumbing, Walmart, Ike Eisenhauer Insurance Agency, Jim and Mel’s Golf Cars, Hot Springs Village Voice, First Electric, Tim Parker Chrysler, Don and Toni Wallace, Stephen and Mary Seitz, Burns Management, Terminix, Roberson and Associates, Fountain Lake Barber Shop, Triple D Realty and Hot Springs Village Real Estate. 
Flight A winners were Brad Baker (nattily attired in plus fours, etc.), Don James, Hank Innfeldt and Cam McKinney. 
Jerry Clark, Don Draper, Gene McMea and Don Jones took Flight B honors, and Robert Neilson, Phil Shroyer, Austin Wyatt and Rick Woolman won Flight C. 
Closest to the pin prizes went to Jim Neal (No. 4), Pieter de Haas (No. 7), Cam McKinney (No. 14) and Bob Bearden (No. 17); longest drive winners were John Bobus and Jane Fremstad. Sue Sutley won closest to the line, and Robert Neilson took the prize in the putting contest. 
Funds raised will support Lions projects, which focus on the vision-impaired, and Boys & Girls Club programs for area youth.
